issue.title: ntru1229
issue.body:
Follows https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1126. CI will only succeed after that has merged.

##### Checklist
- [x] documentation is added or updated
- [x] tests are added or updated

comment.body: Interop test will pass when https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl/pull/79 has been merged

issue.title: GCC 11 throws `mismatched bound` errors on arm64
issue.body:
I am interested in packaging liboqs for Debian. Debian build of ba5b61a7 on arm64 fails due to `mismatched bound` errors:
```
/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/src/kem/kyber/pqclean_kyber512_aarch64/kem.c:24:57: error: argument 1 of type ‘uint8_t[800]’ {aka ‘unsigned char[800]’} with mismatched bound [-Werror=array-parameter=]
   24 | int PQCLEAN_KYBER512_AARCH64_crypto_kem_keypair(uint8_t pk[KYBER_PUBLICKEYBYTES],
      |                                                 ~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from /<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/src/kem/kyber/pqclean_kyber512_aarch64/kem.c:2:
/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/src/kem/kyber/pqclean_kyber512_aarch64/kem.h:14:58: note: previously declared as ‘uint8_t *’ {aka ‘unsigned char *’}
   14 | int PQCLEAN_KYBER512_AARCH64_crypto_kem_keypair(uint8_t *pk, uint8_t *sk);
      |                                                 ~~~~~~~~~^~
```
([full build log](https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=liboqs&arch=arm64&ver=0.7.0.27.gba5b61a7%2Bdfsg-1&stamp=1637141594&raw=0); note Debian turns all GCC warning to errors)

Similar issue was reported as #1035 and seemingly has been fixed since then. Interestingly, most of the other architectures build just fine.

comment.body:
I've fixed it upstream: https://github.com/neon-ntt/neon-ntt/commit/c6ffbcd1e5590e4dddbc604fc80d2ad756485b4d
I also opened a PR to PQClean: https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/pull/429

issue.title: GCC 11 throws `mismatched bound` errors on arm64
issue.body:
I am interested in packaging liboqs for Debian. Debian build of ba5b61a7 on arm64 fails due to `mismatched bound` errors:
```
/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/src/kem/kyber/pqclean_kyber512_aarch64/kem.c:24:57: error: argument 1 of type ‘uint8_t[800]’ {aka ‘unsigned char[800]’} with mismatched bound [-Werror=array-parameter=]
   24 | int PQCLEAN_KYBER512_AARCH64_crypto_kem_keypair(uint8_t pk[KYBER_PUBLICKEYBYTES],
      |                                                 ~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
In file included from /<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/src/kem/kyber/pqclean_kyber512_aarch64/kem.c:2:
```

([full build log](https://buildd.debian.org/status/fetch.php?pkg=liboqs&arch=arm64&ver=0.7.0.27.gba5b61a7%2Bdfsg-1&stamp=1637141594&raw=0); note Debian turns all GCC warning to errors)

Similar issue was reported as #1035 and seemingly has been fixed since then. Interestingly, most of the other architectures build just fine.

comment.body:
> I've fixed it upstream: [neon-ntt/neon-ntt@c6ffbcd](https://github.com/neon-ntt/neon-ntt/commit/c6ffbcd1e5590e4dddbc604fc80d2ad756485b4d) I also opened a PR to PQClean: [PQClean/PQClean#429](https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/pull/429)

Thanks Matthias! I've reviewed and merged them. I'll create a PR for liboqs.

issue.title: CR+LF line endings in some of files
issue.body: I have noticed that `appveyor.yml` and `src/kem/sike/external/P751/AMD64/fp_x64_asm.S` have CR+LF (`\r\n`) line endings. While this is a very minute issue, some of tools employed in Debian packaging have minor problems with it (I should probably find a way to deal with them too). But if there is no difference, maybe the same newline convention could be used throughout the project? If this could not be done for `appveyor.yml` due to usage in Windows, maybe then line endings could be unified throughout all `*asm.S` files?

comment.body: FWIW, my vote would go to (standardize on) LF only. But I'm a diehard UNIX guy... :-) @christianpaquin : Do you feel strongly (or even know of tools that _need_ CRLF)?

issue.title: Changing the ciphertext a keys
issue.body:
Hi,

I am working with the liboqs-python. Wanted to know how can i change the ciphertext and input encryption and shared key. I can see that It is importing oqs library and there are functions like encap and decap inside the oqs.py file where ciphertext is being generated. However, changing oqs.py file does nothing. Could you guide how to make these changes?

thanks

comment.body: someone managed to see the ciphertext?

issue.title: Fix gcc 11 error for Kyber on arm64
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->
Fixes #1125.

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [No] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [No] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: I am running the build right now, looks promising!

issue.title: Changing the ciphertext a keys
issue.body:
Hi,

I am working with the liboqs-python. Wanted to know how can i change the ciphertext and input encryption and shared key. I can see that It is importing oqs library and there are functions like encap and decap inside the oqs.py file where ciphertext is being generated. However, changing oqs.py file does nothing. Could you guide how to make these changes?

thanks

comment.body: Rereading this, I think there's a misunderstanding about what KEMs do. A key encapsulation mechanism does not allow you to specify a plaintext. The "ciphertext" only allows the receiver to decapsulate to arrive at the same shared secret as the sender, but neither part can selectively control the shared secret.  If you want to be able to encrypt an arbitrary plaintext, you would need to use a public key encryption scheme.  While there are standard ways of building a public key encryption scheme from a KEM, that is outside the scope of what liboqs provides.

issue.title: CR+LF line endings in some of files
issue.body: I have noticed that `appveyor.yml` and `src/kem/sike/external/P751/AMD64/fp_x64_asm.S` have CR+LF (`\r\n`) line endings. While this is a very minute issue, some of tools employed in Debian packaging have minor problems with it (I should probably find a way to deal with them too). But if there is no difference, maybe the same newline convention could be used throughout the project? If this could not be done for `appveyor.yml` due to usage in Windows, maybe then line endings could be unified throughout all `*asm.S` files?

comment.body: No strong feelings; we certainly can enforce LF everywhere. Git clients can transform to CRLF locally if needed.
